column4: alright yalll im downloading gutsy as a last resort to see if i can get it to work with my card... i tried installing the binarieis last night, but i dont have a set up internet connection to download them with... can yall show me how to set up my connection in text interface at boot up so i can download the binaries
What is the problem you were having with Feisty?
What GFX card?
And how are you trying to connect to the net?
That should work with fglrx from the repos
So now all you need is to get on the net :)
I'll walk you through :)
How are you connected to the net? ( wired or wireless ) ?
Can you connect wired temporarily ( makes things much easier )

Ok, then do that then run "sudo ifconfig eth0" then "sudo dhclient eth0" ( connecting and configuring with DHCP ) then "sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx" ( installs the driver ) then "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" and choose "fglrx" as the driver when asked

then run "sudo ifconfig eth0" then "sudo dhclient eth0" ( connecting and configuring with DHCP ) then "sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx" ( installs the driver ) then "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" and choose "fglrx" as the driver when asked
I am going to sleep, but once you have done that the driver will be installed, at that point either reboot or run "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart" to get into X
What GPU?
wwats a GPU?
Your graphics card
Are you using the open source drivers or fglrx?
i am using fglrx
can you pastebin the output of "sudo modprobe fglrx" if any ?
there was no terminal output
Can you pastebin the output of "glxinfo" ?
http://pastebin.ca/701721
